metadata.title: CVE-2020-35518 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
When binding against a DN during authentication, the reply from 389-ds-basewill be different whether the DN exists or not. This can be used by anunauthenticated attacker to check the existence of an entry in the LDAPdatabase.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-35518` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

389-ds - 1.4.3.6-2ubuntu0.1~esm1
389-ds-base - 1.4.3.6-2ubuntu0.1~esm1
389-ds-base-libs - 1.4.3.6-2ubuntu0.1~esm1
cockpit-389-ds - 1.4.3.6-2ubuntu0.1~esm1
python3-lib389 - 1.4.3.6-2ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: 389-ds-base package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.3.6-2ubuntu0.1~esm1').
